sources.title: Squibs
sources.description: “Bright musical comedy” “Nice lighthearted trifle” “An absolute delight” (IMDB reviews quotes). A London bobby (Sterling Holloway) romances a cockney flower seller (Betty Balfour) in this semi-musical remake of “Squibs” (1921). It’s no Busby Berkeley/Warner Brothers spectacular, but it is an engaging light comedy with a solid British cast. IMDB rating 5.9. Directed by Henry Edwards. Released in 1935 (UK and IRE only). Complete print.

metadata.Plot: Squibs, a cockney flowerseller with a father overwhelmed by gambling debts wins through with the help of assorted friends and a romantically inclined policeman
metadata.Writer: Michael Hogan, H. Fowler Mear, R.P. Weston
metadata.Actors: Betty Balfour, Gordon Harker, Stanley Holloway
